content: splish splash soap sack by melanie shovelski materials 100% worsted cotton yarn i used lily sugar n cream size h 5mm hook scissors darning or blunt needle abbreviations single_crochet - single_crochet half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet treble_crochet- treble_crochet slip_stitch- slip_stitch st- stitch magic_ring- magic_ring note turning chain does not count as a stitch directions make a magic_ring round 1 chain 1 - work 12 double_crochet in the ring - slip_stitch in beginning chain to join - pull magic_ring tight round 2 increase round chain 2 - *work 2 double_crochet in next st - double_crochet in next st repeat from * around - slip st in beginning chain to join fins round 3 increase round repeat round 2 make 2 round 4 chain 2 - work 1 half_double_crochet and 1 single_crochet in the first st - *skip 1 st - 1 half_double_crochet and 1 single_crochet in the next st repeat from* around chain 10 starting with the 1st chain from the hook crochet the following round 5 chain 2 - skip the first st - *work 1 half_double_crochet and 1 single_crochet into the next st - skip 1 single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet double_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet into the last chain single_crochet and st repeat from* around - slip_stitch to join slip_stitch work the opposite side of the chain the same way round 6-10 repeat round 5 fasten_off - leaving a long tail for sewing - weave in the beginning thread on the opposite end round 11 chain 1 - work 1 half_double_crochet into each st - slip_stitch to join sew fins to the bottom of the soap sack - weave in all round 12 chain 1 - work 1 single_crochet into each st - slip_stitch your last st of the row and chain 15 slip_stitch back in the same stitch slip_stitch in the next 3 stitches fasten_off weave in all ends ends
